id: Tell me a joke

id: Another joke please

id: Tell me something funny
text: Why do cows wear bells? Because their horns do not work.

id: One more joke
text: Why do we never trust stairs? Because they are always up to something.

id: I want to hear a joke
text: Why did the student eat his homework? Because the teacher said it was a piece of cake.

id: Can you tell me a funny one
text: Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything.

id: Tell me a silly joke
text: Why did the bicycle fall over? Because it was two tired.

id: Give me a short joke

id: Last joke please
text: Why was the computer cold? Because it left its Windows open.

id: Hit me with a joke

id: Do you know any jokes?

text: Why did the invisible man turn down the job offer? He couldn't see himself doing it.

id: I'm in the mood for a joke

id: Give me a reason to laugh

id: Make me laugh out loud

id: Do your thing, tell a joke

id: I'd love a joke right now

id: Surprise me with a joke
text: What did the ocean say to the beach? Nothing, it just waved.

id: Go on, tell me a joke

id: I'm all ears for a joke
text: What did the grape say when it got stepped on? Nothing, it just let out a little wine.

text: Why did the pillow fight start? It was a case of assault and flattery.

text: What has many keys but can't open a single lock? A piano.

text: What has a neck but no head? A bottle.

text: What has hands but can't clap? A clock.

text: What gets wetter as it dries? A towel.

text: What can you catch but not throw? A cold.

text: What did the pencil say to the other pencil? You're looking sharp.

text: I used to hate facial hair, but then it grew on me.

text: I'm reading a book on anti-gravity. It's impossible to put down.

id: I love puns, give me one
text: I invented a new word: Plagiarism.

text: What's the best thing about Switzerland? I don't know, but the flag is a big plus.

text: How does a penguin build its house? Igloos it together.

text: I would tell a chemistry joke, but I know I wouldn't get a reaction.

text: I used to be a baker, but I couldn't make enough dough.

text: What do elves learn in school? The elf-abet.

text: What do you call a scared Santa Claus? A Santa Claustrophobic.

id: Make me laugh about holidays
text: What do you call a snowman in the summer? A puddle.

id: A joke about Santa
text: What do you get if you cross a Christmas tree with an apple? A pineapple.

id: I think I'm coming down with a cold.
text: Oh no! Time for tea, vitamins, and your favorite comfort show. I'll keep you company.

id: I just had the weirdest dream.
text: You have to tell me everything. Were we in it? Was it about sentient toast?

id: I can't believe it's already Monday tomorrow.
text: Ugh, don't remind me. Let's make the most of what's left of the weekend!

id: I'm trying to eat healthier.
text: That's a great goal! Want to swap recipe ideas? I found a great one for avocado chocolate mousse.

id: The package I ordered finally arrived!
text: The moment we've all been waiting for! Is it everything you hoped for? Show me!

id: I think I need a digital detox.
text: That's actually a brilliant idea. Let's plan a phone-free adventure for this weekend.

id: I just listened to the most amazing podcast.
text: Ooh, recommend it to me! I need something new for my commute.

id: My plant is dying and I don't know why.
text: RIP little green friend. Too much water? Not enough? We can be plant funeral directors together.

id: I'm so proud of myself for finally cleaning my room.
text: YES! That's huge. I bet it feels amazing. Now try not to mess it up for at least... 24 hours?

id: The sunset tonight was incredible.
text: Nature showing off again. Did you get a picture? That's pure serotonin right there.

id: I have a really important interview in an hour.
text: You've got this! They're lucky to have you. Take a deep breath and go wow them.

id: I just scrolled past my ex's wedding photos.
text: Oof. That's a landmine. Let's order greasy food and mock their cake choices. It's therapeutic.

id: I'm thinking of adopting a pet.
text: Stop, this is the best news! Dog, cat, rabbit, llama? I'll help you brainstorm names.

id: I accidentally sent an embarrassing text to the wrong person.
text: Classic. How bad is it? On a scale of 'oops' to 'changing my name and moving country'?

id: I'm learning how to meditate.
text: Amazing! It's so hard to quiet the mind. How's it going? Do you feel any different?

id: I just finished a huge project I've been stressed about for months.
text: HUGE congratulations! That weight is off your shoulders. How are you celebrating?

id: My favorite band just announced a new album.
text: This is not a drill! Mark the calendar. We are having a listening party.

id: I think I left my umbrella at your place.
text: Yep, it's here! It's safe and sound, keeping my umbrella company.

id: I'm trying to be more positive.
text: I love that energy. It's a practice, right? Some days are easier than others. I'm with you.

id: I just saw a dog wearing a tiny hat.
text: My day is officially made. Please tell me you have photographic evidence.

id: I'm stuck in traffic and I'm going to be so late.
text: The worst feeling. Crank up the music and have a one-person car concert. It helps.

id: I can't decide what to have for dinner.
text: The eternal struggle. Let's play eeny-meeny-miny-moe between pasta, stir-fry, or just cereal.

id: I think I need new glasses.
text: Fun! It's a style upgrade. What kind of frames are you thinking? Bold or subtle?

id: I just donated a bunch of old clothes.
text: That's awesome! Feels good to declutter and help others. Win-win.

id: The power just went out at my house.
text: Spooky! Time for candles, ghost stories, and hoping the ice cream doesn't melt.

id: I'm going to a concert alone tonight.
text: That's so cool and brave! You'll have a blast. Sometimes it's more fun that way.

id: I think I'm allergic to my new laundry detergent.
text: Ah, the itchy mystery is solved! Back to the unscented kind for you.

id: I just had a major disagreement with my best friend.
text: That's tough. Do you need to vent, or do you want advice on how to patch things up?

id: I'm going to try and wake up early to exercise tomorrow.
text: I believe in you! Text me when you're up, I'll be your virtual cheerleader (from my warm bed).

id: I just found a forgotten $20 in my pocket!
text: Free money! It's like a gift from past you. What are you spending it on?

id: I'm nervous about going to the doctor tomorrow.
text: Totally normal to feel that way. It'll be over before you know it. Want me to check in with you after?

id: I think I want to start a blog.
text: Do it! What would you write about? I'll be your first subscriber and biggest fan.

id: I just accidentally called my teacher 'mom'.
text: NO. The classic nightmare. Did the earth swallow you up? I would have simply vanished.

id: The weather can't make up its mind today.
text: Sun, rain, hail, repeat. Dress in layers and embrace the chaos.

id: I'm trying to cut down on caffeine.
text: Respect. The headaches are real though. Herbal tea and lots of water!

id: I just got a handwritten letter in the mail.
text: A true relic! That's so special. Who's it from?

id: I think my neighbor is secretly a great baker, I keep smelling amazing things.
text: You need to become their friend immediately. Strategic friendship for baked goods is totally valid.

id: I'm feeling really unmotivated to do anything today.
text: Those days happen. Be kind to yourself. Maybe just pick one tiny thing to do. Or don't. It's okay.

id: I just successfully assembled furniture without any leftover screws!
text: You are a wizard. An engineering genius. I'm genuinely impressed.

id: I think I want to learn how to sew.
text: That's a super useful skill! You could mend clothes and even make your own. YouTube tutorials are your best friend.

id: I just rewatched that show we love, it's even better the second time.
text: Right? You catch so many little details you missed before. We have to talk about that one scene again...

id: I'm going to a birthday party where I won't know anyone.
text: You'll be fine! Just find the snacks or the pet. Those are always the best people to talk to.

id: I think I just heard a weird noise in my house.
text: It's definitely a ghost. Or the house settling. 99% chance it's the house settling... probably.

id: I'm trying to be more patient.
text: A virtue we all struggle with. Deep breaths. Counting to ten. I'm trying right there with you.

id: I just saw a kid perfectly imitate their parent's exasperated sigh.
text: Kids are terrifyingly accurate mirrors. That's hilarious and probably a little humbling for the parent.

id: I'm thinking of doing a no-spend month.
text: That's a fantastic challenge! We can find free things to do. Parks, hikes, movie nights at home.

id: I just got a new phone and I feel like I don't know how to use it.
text: The struggle is real. It takes a week to feel normal again. What's the most confusing part?

id: I think I want to volunteer somewhere.
text: That's a wonderful idea. What causes are you passionate about? I can help you look for places.

id: I just had a moment of pure panic because I thought I lost my phone... while I was holding it.
text: We've all been there. The panic is so real, followed by immediate relief and self-judgment.

id: I'm going to try and make my own bread.
text: Yes! The house will smell amazing. Be prepared for it to be oddly satisfying and slightly frustrating.

id: I think I need to get better at saying 'no'.
text: Such an important skill. Your time and energy are valuable. Practice with me: 'No, thank you.' See? Not so bad!

id: I just found a childhood photo of me with a truly terrible haircut.
text: Please, I need to see this. We all had those phases. It builds character (and great blackmail material).

id: I'm feeling overwhelmed by all the bad news in the world.
text: It's a lot to carry. It's okay to take a break from the news cycle. Focus on the good things right in front of you.

id: I think I want to try rock climbing.
text: Fun! And a great workout. Definitely go to a gym with a buddy first to learn the ropes. Literally.

id: I just got a compliment from a stranger and it made my whole week.
text: Those are the best! It's crazy how a few kind words from someone can have such a big impact.
